instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message:
Received this machine with no magsafe light and no power. G3Hot was present, SYS_ONEWIRE was all good.
C6992 corroded but tested fine. Replaced and got a light but still no power. 
R5491 / R5492 corroded and resistance was 180-200k on pins 4&6 of Q5490. Power in, but not out pin 3. Replaced all and got power out pin 3. (Q5480/R5482/R5481 looked bad so they were replaced too). 
Still no power on the board. Followed pin 3 of Q5490 to R5499 & R5498. Both looked corroded, both were replaced. While replacing R5498, I noticed that a good amount of components in the area looked slightly corroded. Cleaned and reflowed the area - board powers on now. 
Reassembled **with the correct battery screws** and all appears well. Run AST 1 and get a flag on the (A) DC in: 0.116A. Battery is not charging but is detected and in good condition. Computer runs fine, not bogged. In the OS it shows charging in the status bar, but in the system report is says "not charging".

Rechecked Q5490/Q5480 - Resistance between 4&6 of Q5480 is 250k. R5481 - 69k, R5482 - 190k. (they were both at 100k before powering on). 
Followed PBUSVSENS_EN back to R7987, R7981, R7985, R7988, R7986, R7931, R7978. 
R7985 pin 1 = OL V to ground, pin 2 = 0.472v to G, 20kO resistance
R7931 pin 2 = 0.337v to G, pin 1 = 0.554v to G, 100kO, Pin 2 = 3.40v 
All others are between 0.4v and 0.6v to G. 

Checking around U7000 for short:
C7025 measures 0.175v to G on pin 2, this follows all the way through F7040

Should I be looking at Q7080, Q7030, U7000, Q7931, Q5480?  

Other readings:
R5491: Pin 1/2 to ground - OL, 100kO between 1&2
R5492: Pin 1 - 2.416v, Pin 2 - OL to G- 100kO between 1&2 
Pin 2 of R5280 is 0.552
Pin 2 of R5281 is 0.555

Let me know if other readings are needed. 

Also, not as important, Bluetooth is not detected in AST 1...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message: Checked resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the ISL? Known good charger and DC in board?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message:
Thanks for the quick response. 

27/28 is at 20.4 O.
17/18 is at 3.2 O. R7051 - 2.4 O, R7052 - 0.3 O. 

Used multiple chargers and power supply. Known good DC IN board. 

Is C7025 measuring 0.175v to G on pin 2 normal?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
[SOLVED]820-3462 not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message: Will replace Q7055 and get back.. Any way of testing before replacing or is this a common known failure point?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message: If you replaced 7055 replace 7030 and the ISL all at the same time

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message: First thing I would suspect is the battery, can still be faulty even if it reports as working fine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message:
Replaced Q7055 and ISL.. nothing. Tried a new battery.. same. 
I noticed that if I switched from the power supply to a MagSafe (or between chargers), the light wouldn't come on until an SMC reset. Decided to try another ISL.. that was it. Third one was the charm. Works with all chargers and both batteries now. 

Thanks for the help everyone. SOLVED! This model is almost as fun as the TouchBars..
